caller_intent: Scott is inquiring about potential cost savings by switching his auto insurance to liability-only coverage (excluding his wife) and is seeking clarification on current policy details, including coverage for his van, deductibles, and the impact of adding his son Tristan as a driver once he obtains a license.
resolution_steps: Heather confirms Scott's current policy details with Auto Owners (AO) and National General, including deductibles for different vehicles.
Explains that switching to liability-only coverage for his wife would reduce costs slightly but maintains full coverage on other vehicles.
Clarifies that National General no longer writes home policies in North Carolina, so bundling with AO provides a discount.
Notes that adding Tristan as a driver once he turns 18 will require proof of ID/permit and may affect premiums.
Confirms the adjusted monthly rate of $232.52 after resolving coverage discrepancies.
knowledge_required: Auto insurance coverage types (liability vs. full comp)
Deductible differences between carriers (e.g., Ultima, Cintura)
Bundling discounts for home and auto policies
Process for adding new drivers to policies
summary: Scott discusses his auto and home insurance policies with Heather, seeking cost reductions by adjusting coverage. Heather explains current rates, deductibles, and bundling discounts, confirming a slight rate reduction while maintaining full coverage on key vehicles. Scott decides to keep the current setup, with future considerations for adding his son as a driver.
